cluster_classes.class_description: Entities that function as commercial brands in the sports context, including sports teams themselves and the branded identities associated with them.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Sports teams and athletes can also serve as powerful brands, attracting sponsors and endorsements.

members.entity_description: Organized groups of athletes competing in sports, functioning as commercial and marketing brands.
Strong commercial identities associated with sports teams and athletes that attract sponsorship and endorsements.

cluster_classes.class_description: Commercial relationships in which organizations sponsor athletes or teams, including the sponsoring entities and the endorsement agreements they fund.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Attracting sponsors and endorsements that bring in millions of dollars in revenue.

members.entity_description: Organizations or companies that financially support sports teams or athletes in exchange for promotion.
Commercial agreements where athletes or teams promote products or services, generating revenue.

args.new_description: Sports teams and related entities considered as commercial brands in sports marketing and sponsorship contexts.
args.justification: The class cleanly captures sports-related brand entities; only the broader Class_Group and a more precise commercial-brand type hint need to be set to align it with related sponsorship concepts.

args.new_description: Commercial sponsorship and endorsement relationships between organizations and sports teams or athletes.
args.justification: This class represents sponsorship and endorsement relationships in sports; assigning it to the same Sports Marketing & Sponsorship Class_Group as Sports Brands captures their shared domain while preserving their distinct scopes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Sports teams and related entities considered as commercial brands in sports marketing and sponsorship contexts.
executed_decisions.justification: The class cleanly captures sports-related brand entities; only the broader Class_Group and a more precise commercial-brand type hint need to be set to align it with related sponsorship concepts.

executed_decisions.new_description: Commercial sponsorship and endorsement relationships between organizations and sports teams or athletes.
executed_decisions.justification: This class represents sponsorship and endorsement relationships in sports; assigning it to the same Sports Marketing & Sponsorship Class_Group as Sports Brands captures their shared domain while preserving their distinct scopes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Macro- and meso-level economic systems, including local, national, and global economies that interact with sports and other activities.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: local economies, the global economy, and the economy as systems of production and consumption affected by sports

members.entity_description: Regional economic systems around host locations that are stimulated by major sporting events.
The worldwide economic system in which the sports industry now plays a major role.
The system of production and consumption to which sports contribute.

cluster_classes.class_description: The organized sports industry and its associated markets for sports-related goods and services.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: the sports industry as a major player with billions spent on sports-related products and services

members.entity_description: The aggregate of businesses and activities related to sports, now a major global economic sector.
Goods and services associated with sports on which billions of dollars are spent annually.

args.new_description: Macro- and meso-level economic systems (local, national, and global) that interact with and are influenced by sports.
args.justification: Refines the label and type hint to emphasize that this class covers broad economic systems (local, national, global) as contexts for sports, and assigns a shared Class_Group that captures its close relation to the sports economy domain.

args.new_description: The organized sports industry and associated markets for sports-related goods and services as a distinct economic sector.
args.justification: Clarifies that this class covers the sports industry as a specific economic sector (firms and markets for sports-related goods and services), and aligns it under the same Sports and Economics Class_Group as the broader economic systems class while keeping the concepts distinct.

executed_decisions.new_description: Macro- and meso-level economic systems (local, national, and global) that interact with and are influenced by sports.
executed_decisions.justification: Refines the label and type hint to emphasize that this class covers broad economic systems (local, national, global) as contexts for sports, and assigns a shared Class_Group that captures its close relation to the sports economy domain.

executed_decisions.new_description: The organized sports industry and associated markets for sports-related goods and services as a distinct economic sector.
executed_decisions.justification: Clarifies that this class covers the sports industry as a specific economic sector (firms and markets for sports-related goods and services), and aligns it under the same Sports and Economics Class_Group as the broader economic systems class while keeping the concepts distinct.

cluster_classes.class_description: Geopolitical locations that host major sporting events and experience related economic impacts such as revenue and tourism.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: host cities and countries that generate revenue, create jobs, and boost tourism from major sporting events

members.entity_description: Cities that host major sporting events and experience associated economic impacts such as revenue and tourism.
Countries that host major sporting events and benefit economically through revenue and related activities.

cluster_classes.class_description: Large-scale sports events that bring together participants or teams from multiple countries and attract worldwide audiences.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: events that bring together millions of people from around the globe, transcending language barriers and political divisions

members.entity_description: Large sports competitions between teams or individuals from multiple countries.
A major international soccer tournament bringing together teams and fans from many countries.
A major international multi-sport event involving athletes from around the world.

cluster_classes.class_description: Sports and sports-related events with large international followings and significant cultural and economic impact, such as soccer and major sporting events like the World Cup or Olympics.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: World Cup in soccer or the Olympics are events that bring together millions of people from around the globe.

members.entity_description: Large-scale sports competitions that generate revenue, jobs, tourism, and broader economic activity for hosts.
A global team sport in which the World Cup is a premier international tournament.

args.justification: The entity 'major sporting events' is an event-type concept aligned with other international tournaments (World Cup, Olympics) in ClsC_480a20b7, while ClsC_d7c21bf5 should focus on broader sports phenomena such as the sport 'soccer' itself.

args.new_description: Large-scale international sports competitions and tournaments (e.g., World Cup, Olympics, major sporting events) that bring together participants or teams from multiple countries and attract worldwide audiences.
args.justification: After adding 'major sporting events' to this class, updating the description and assigning a shared class_group clarifies that this class is the canonical home for global sports tournaments and connects it to related location/phenomenon classes.

args.new_description: Geopolitical locations (cities, countries) that host major international sporting events and experience related economic impacts such as revenue, jobs, and tourism.
args.justification: This class describes cities and countries in their role as hosts of global sporting events, so assigning it to the same 'Global Sporting Events & Impacts' class_group links it with the events and related phenomena while keeping its location-specific scope.

args.new_description: Sports with large international followings and significant cultural and economic impact, such as soccer as a global team sport.
args.justification: Once the event-type member 'major sporting events' is reassigned, this class is effectively about the sport 'soccer' as a global phenomenon; renaming, updating the type hint/description, and aligning the class_group clarifies its focus on globally popular sports within the broader global sporting events ecosystem.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'major sporting events' is an event-type concept aligned with other international tournaments (World Cup, Olympics) in ClsC_480a20b7, while ClsC_d7c21bf5 should focus on broader sports phenomena such as the sport 'soccer' itself.

executed_decisions.new_description: Large-scale international sports competitions and tournaments (e.g., World Cup, Olympics, major sporting events) that bring together participants or teams from multiple countries and attract worldwide audiences.
executed_decisions.justification: After adding 'major sporting events' to this class, updating the description and assigning a shared class_group clarifies that this class is the canonical home for global sports tournaments and connects it to related location/phenomenon classes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Geopolitical locations (cities, countries) that host major international sporting events and experience related economic impacts such as revenue, jobs, and tourism.
executed_decisions.justification: This class describes cities and countries in their role as hosts of global sporting events, so assigning it to the same 'Global Sporting Events & Impacts' class_group links it with the events and related phenomena while keeping its location-specific scope.

executed_decisions.new_description: Sports with large international followings and significant cultural and economic impact, such as soccer as a global team sport.
executed_decisions.justification: Once the event-type member 'major sporting events' is reassigned, this class is effectively about the sport 'soccer' as a global phenomenon; renaming, updating the type hint/description, and aligning the class_group clarifies its focus on globally popular sports within the broader global sporting events ecosystem.

cluster_classes.class_description: Human cultures and societies, both historical and contemporary, that are described in terms of how sports shape or influence them.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: sports have always played a significant role in shaping cultures around the world, from ancient civilizations to modern societies

members.entity_description: The shared beliefs, practices, values, and social systems of communities that are influenced by sports.
Human communities and social structures that are shaped and influenced by sports in various ways.
Shared customs, beliefs, and social behaviors of groups around the world influenced by sports.
Early complex human societies in history where sports already played a social role.
Contemporary human societies in which sports continue to influence culture and community.

cluster_classes.class_description: Ethical and social values that support positive social functioning and are promoted through activities like sports.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Sports promote values essential for a healthy society... bring people together, promote important values.

members.entity_name: values essential for a healthy society
members.entity_description: Core social values promoted by sports that support the functioning of a healthy society.
Key ethical and social values that sports help promote.

cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract and collective concepts describing how sports interact with culture and social structures, including their role in societies and contributions to a healthy society.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Sports used to promote values essential for a healthy society and challenge stereotypes in many societies.

members.entity_name: role of sports in our culture
members.entity_description: The recognized impact and significance of sports within a given culture.
A well-functioning society characterized by positive values and social well-being.
Human communities or nations where sports are used to challenge stereotypes and promote equality.

remarks: All current members have been reassigned to better-scoped classes, so this class is effectively empty and may be deprecated or removed in a future cleanup pass.

cluster_classes.class_description: A written composition that explores a specific topic or question, typically in a structured, prose format. This class groups standalone essays as textual documents.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: The written work that will discuss impacts of sports on culture and society.

members.entity_description: The written work that will discuss impacts of sports on culture and society.

args.justification: The entity 'healthy society' is a social system influenced by sports and fits better with other society/culture entities in 'Sport-Influenced Societies' than with abstract interaction concepts.
The entity 'societies' describes human communities where sports affect stereotypes, aligning with the social systems in 'Sport-Influenced Societies' rather than with abstract concepts.
The entity 'role of sports in our culture' is an abstract concept about how sports shape culture and aligns with the value-focused abstract concepts in 'Social Values'.

args.new_description: Human cultures, civilizations, and societies, historical and contemporary, whose structures, norms, and identities are shaped or influenced by sports.
args.justification: After adding 'healthy society' and 'societies' from a mixed abstract class, this class consistently represents social systems influenced by sports and should be grouped under a broader sports–culture–society theme.

args.new_description: Ethical and social values that sports help promote, supporting cohesion, fairness, and the functioning of a healthy society.
args.justification: This class now groups abstract notions such as 'values essential for a healthy society', 'important values', and the 'role of sports in our culture', warranting a clearer label and alignment under the sports–culture–society group.

args.new_description: A placeholder class that previously mixed abstract concepts and social systems; its entities have been reassigned to more coherent classes.
args.remark: All current members have been reassigned to better-scoped classes, so this class is effectively empty and may be deprecated or removed in a future cleanup pass.
args.justification: After reassigning its mixed entities to more coherent classes, this class no longer has a clear independent role and should be marked as a cleaned-up, placeholder class under the same topical group.

args.new_description: A standalone written composition in prose that explores a topic such as the impacts of sports on culture and society.
args.justification: This class represents a document genre ('this essay') rather than a social or cultural concept, so it should be grouped under a generic document-type class group.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'healthy society' is a social system influenced by sports and fits better with other society/culture entities in 'Sport-Influenced Societies' than with abstract interaction concepts.

The entity 'role of sports in our culture' is an abstract concept about how sports shape culture and aligns with the value-focused abstract concepts in 'Social Values'.

executed_decisions.justification: This class now groups abstract notions such as 'values essential for a healthy society', 'important values', and the 'role of sports in our culture', warranting a clearer label and alignment under the sports–culture–society group.

executed_decisions.new_description: A placeholder class that previously mixed abstract concepts and social systems; its entities have been reassigned to more coherent classes.
executed_decisions.remark: All current members have been reassigned to better-scoped classes, so this class is effectively empty and may be deprecated or removed in a future cleanup pass.
executed_decisions.justification: After reassigning its mixed entities to more coherent classes, this class no longer has a clear independent role and should be marked as a cleaned-up, placeholder class under the same topical group.

executed_decisions.new_description: A standalone written composition in prose that explores a topic such as the impacts of sports on culture and society.
executed_decisions.justification: This class represents a document genre ('this essay') rather than a social or cultural concept, so it should be grouped under a generic document-type class group.

cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract social concepts concerning gender, including normative expectations and principles of fairness and equal treatment across genders.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Women’s inclusion in male-dominated sports helps challenge gender norms and promote gender-based equality.

members.entity_description: The principle of equal rights, opportunities, and status regardless of gender, including efforts in sports to challenge gender norms and promote fairness.
Social expectations about gender roles that are challenged by women’s inclusion in certain sports.

cluster_classes.class_description: Entities describing the practice, actors, and contexts involved in integrating women into traditionally male-dominated sports to challenge gender norms and promote equality.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Inclusion of women in traditionally male-dominated sports has helped to challenge gender norms and promote equality.

members.entity_name: inclusion of women in traditionally male-dominated sports
members.entity_description: Participation of women in sports historically dominated by men, used to challenge gender norms.
Female participants whose inclusion in male-dominated sports challenges gender norms.
Sports that have traditionally had predominantly male participation and control.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts describing beneficial or transformative effects in society associated with sports, including social change, positive change, and inclusivity.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Sports used as a force for positive change, inclusivity, and broader social change.

members.entity_description: Transformations in social norms, structures, and power relations that can be driven or influenced by sports, including challenging stereotypes, promoting equality, and advancing social justice.
Beneficial transformation in society that sports can be used to promote.
Practice of including and valuing diverse people within sports and society.

cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract social issues and values—such as stereotypes and social justice—that sports can address or influence.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Sports have been used to challenge stereotypes, promote gender equality, and advocate for social justice.

members.entity_description: Oversimplified ideas about groups that sports can be used to challenge.
The pursuit of fairness and equity in society that sports can help advocate for.

cluster_classes.class_description: Societal problems involving unfairness, rights violations, or broad public concerns that athletes address through advocacy and public statements.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: athletes have used their platforms to speak out against discrimination and injustice, bringing attention to important social issues

members.entity_description: Unfair or prejudicial treatment that athletes publicly oppose using their influence and visibility.
Situations of unfairness or violation of rights targeted by athlete advocacy and public statements.
Broad set of societal problems highlighted by athletes when they speak out using their platforms.

args.justification: The entity 'inclusivity' is a social value/theme that conceptually aligns better with 'Social Change Themes' (stereotypes, social justice) than with outcome-oriented social change processes, improving thematic coherence across classes.

args.new_description: Abstract social concepts concerning gender in sport, including normative expectations and principles of fairness and equal treatment across genders.
args.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
args.justification: Clarifies the sports-specific context and assigns a shared Class_Group connecting it to other sports-related social justice and change classes.

args.new_description: Practices, actors, and contexts involved in integrating women into traditionally male-dominated sports to challenge gender norms and promote equality.
args.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
args.justification: Keeps a distinct class for gender integration as a concrete social phenomenon while linking it via a common Class_Group to related social justice and equality concepts.

args.new_description: Process-oriented concepts describing beneficial or transformative social effects associated with sports, such as social change and positive change.
args.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
args.justification: After moving 'inclusivity' to a theme-oriented class, this class now cleanly represents process-oriented social impacts, and is grouped with other sports-related social issue and change classes.

args.new_description: Abstract social themes and values—such as stereotypes, inclusivity, and social justice—that sports can address or influence.
args.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
args.justification: Incorporates 'inclusivity' alongside stereotypes and social justice, making this a coherent theme/value class, and links it via Class_Group to related social change and issue classes.

args.new_description: Societal problems involving unfairness, rights violations, or broad public concerns that athletes address through advocacy and public statements, such as discrimination and injustice.
args.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
args.justification: Keeps a distinct bucket for concrete social issues while aligning it under the same Class_Group as related gender, theme, and process classes for a coherent sports-and-social-change schema.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'inclusivity' is a social value/theme that conceptually aligns better with 'Social Change Themes' (stereotypes, social justice) than with outcome-oriented social change processes, improving thematic coherence across classes.

executed_decisions.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
executed_decisions.justification: After moving 'inclusivity' to a theme-oriented class, this class now cleanly represents process-oriented social impacts, and is grouped with other sports-related social issue and change classes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Abstract social themes and values—such as stereotypes, inclusivity, and social justice—that sports can address or influence.
executed_decisions.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
executed_decisions.justification: Incorporates 'inclusivity' alongside stereotypes and social justice, making this a coherent theme/value class, and links it via Class_Group to related social change and issue classes.

executed_decisions.new_description: Societal problems involving unfairness, rights violations, or broad public concerns that athletes address through advocacy and public statements, such as discrimination and injustice.
executed_decisions.new_class_group: Sports, Social Issues, and Social Change
executed_decisions.justification: Keeps a distinct bucket for concrete social issues while aligning it under the same Class_Group as related gender, theme, and process classes for a coherent sports-and-social-change schema.

cluster_classes.class_description: Psychological and social skills that individuals develop through participation in sports, such as teamwork, perseverance, and resilience.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Through participation in sports, individuals learn important life skills such as teamwork, perseverance, and resilience.

members.entity_description: Important practical and psychological skills individuals learn from engaging in sports.
The ability to work effectively and cooperatively with others toward a common goal.
The capacity to persist in efforts despite difficulties, learned through sports participation.
The ability to recover from setbacks and continue striving, developed through sports.

cluster_classes.class_description: Major areas of a person’s life—non-work and work contexts—where lessons from sports participation can be applied.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: These lessons translate into other areas of life, helping individuals...in their personal and professional lives.

members.entity_description: Individuals’ non-work life domains where lessons from sports help handle challenges.
Work-related life domains where lessons from sports assist in handling challenges.

cluster_classes.class_description: Result states in sports that athletes must learn to handle, including both positive and negative outcomes.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: athletes must ... learn how to deal with both success and failure

members.entity_description: Positive outcomes in sports that athletes must learn how to handle.
Negative outcomes in sports that athletes must learn how to handle.

cluster_classes.class_description: Persons who take part in sports activities and develop skills or life lessons through that participation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: People who participate in sports and gain life skills from that participation.

members.entity_description: People who participate in sports and must collaborate, overcome obstacles, and handle success and failure.
People who participate in sports and gain life skills from that participation.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts describing life skills and personal development outcomes gained through participation in sports, such as cooperation and coping with success and failure.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Life lessons learned through sports, such as cooperation and dealing with success and failure.

members.entity_description: Life lessons learned through sports, such as cooperation and dealing with success and failure.

args.new_name: Life Skills and Lessons from Sports
args.new_description: Psychological, social, and practical life skills and lessons developed through participation in sports, such as teamwork, perseverance, resilience, cooperation, and coping with success and failure.
args.justification: Both classes describe life skills and broader lessons gained from sports with overlapping semantics (skills like teamwork, perseverance, resilience and general lessons from sports participation), so they should be a single coherent class rather than two near-duplicates.
The merged class captures life skills and lessons specifically developed through sports participation, fitting a higher-level group focused on personal development outcomes from sports.

Life Domains (personal and professional lives) are the application contexts for life skills learned from sports, so they belong in the same overarching group capturing sports-based personal development and its transfer to other life areas.

Performance Outcomes (success and failure) are key experiences athletes must learn to cope with through sports, tightly linked to the development of life skills and lessons, so they should share the same sports-based personal development group.

Sports Participants (athletes/individuals) are the agents who acquire life skills and lessons through sports and apply them in other life domains, making them part of the same conceptual cluster of sports-based personal development.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes describe life skills and broader lessons gained from sports with overlapping semantics (skills like teamwork, perseverance, resilience and general lessons from sports participation), so they should be a single coherent class rather than two near-duplicates.
The merged class captures life skills and lessons specifically developed through sports participation, fitting a higher-level group focused on personal development outcomes from sports.

Life Domains (personal and professional lives) are the application contexts for life skills learned from sports, so they belong in the same overarching group capturing sports-based personal development and its transfer to other life areas.

Performance Outcomes (success and failure) are key experiences athletes must learn to cope with through sports, tightly linked to the development of life skills and lessons, so they should share the same sports-based personal development group.

Sports Participants (athletes/individuals) are the agents who acquire life skills and lessons through sports and apply them in other life domains, making them part of the same conceptual cluster of sports-based personal development.

cluster_classes.class_description: Obstacles to interaction or understanding between groups—such as linguistic, political, or broader social divides—that sports can help transcend.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: transcending language barriers and political divisions... sports... breaking down barriers

members.entity_description: Differences in spoken or written languages that can hinder communication between people.
Differences and separations between people or nations due to political views or systems.
Social or cultural obstacles that sports can help to break down.

cluster_classes.class_description: Abstract concepts describing how sports structure or reshape relationships between people and groups, such as transcending divisions and creating links.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: sports have the power to transcend boundaries and build bridges between individuals and communities

members.entity_description: Divisions or separations between people that sports can transcend.
Connections formed between people and groups through sports.

args.justification: The entity 'boundaries' is defined as divisions or separations between people that sports can transcend, which aligns conceptually with social and cultural barriers rather than connection metaphors.
This class represents social and cultural obstacles that sports can help overcome, fitting into a broader group about how sports relate to social divisions and connections.

args.new_description: Metaphorical or abstract concepts describing how sports build or reshape connections between people and groups, such as forming bridges between individuals and communities.
args.justification: After moving the obstacle-like 'boundaries' entity to the barriers class, this class is focused on connection metaphors and should share a Class_Group with the related barriers class to reflect their opposing but related social roles of sport.

executed_decisions.justification: The entity 'boundaries' is defined as divisions or separations between people that sports can transcend, which aligns conceptually with social and cultural barriers rather than connection metaphors.
This class represents social and cultural obstacles that sports can help overcome, fitting into a broader group about how sports relate to social divisions and connections.

executed_decisions.new_description: Metaphorical or abstract concepts describing how sports build or reshape connections between people and groups, such as forming bridges between individuals and communities.
executed_decisions.justification: After moving the obstacle-like 'boundaries' entity to the barriers class, this class is focused on connection metaphors and should share a Class_Group with the related barriers class to reflect their opposing but related social roles of sport.

cluster_classes.class_description: Social bonds and shared identity formed among people through engagement with sports, emphasizing unity, belonging, and solidarity.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: bringing people together, fostering a sense of community... unite people... camaraderie of fans

members.entity_description: Feeling of belonging and social connection fostered through participation in sports.
Shared enthusiasm and interest that unites diverse people around sports.
Sense of friendship and solidarity among sports spectators.

cluster_classes.class_description: Human actors directly or indirectly involved in sports, including athletes and diverse groups of people brought together by sporting events.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: people from different backgrounds and beliefs... athletes have used their platforms

members.entity_name: people from different backgrounds and beliefs
members.entity_description: Individuals with diverse cultural and ideological identities brought together by sports.
Individuals who participate in sports and can use their public presence to influence social and economic issues.

cluster_classes.class_description: Emotional and motivational experiences elicited by sports, including excitement, inspiration, and shared affect among participants and spectators.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: thrill of competition, the camaraderie of fans, or the inspiration of athletes

members.entity_description: Excitement and emotional intensity produced by sporting contests.
Sense of friendship and solidarity among sports spectators.
Motivational influence that athletes exert on individuals and communities.

cluster_classes.class_description: Psychological states experienced by sports fans, such as belonging and pride, that arise around their teams and athletes.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: These events create a sense of belonging and pride among fans...

members.entity_description: A feeling of being part of a group or community created among sports fans.
A feeling of satisfaction and esteem experienced by sports fans for their teams or athletes.

cluster_classes.class_description: Human and organizational actors involved in sports fandom contexts, including fans themselves and the athletes or teams they support.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: fans, who come together... favorite athletes and teams

members.entity_description: Supporters who gather to celebrate and follow their favorite athletes and teams.
Athletes admired and supported by fans during major sports events.
Sports teams that fans support and whose achievements they celebrate.

cluster_classes.class_description: Social practices and recurring rituals that emerge from people participating together in sports, creating common memories and customs.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: sports influence culture through the creation of shared experiences and traditions

members.entity_description: Common events and memories that people participate in together through sports.
Repeated customs and rituals that develop around sports within cultures.

cluster_classes.class_description: A shared objective that members of a group, such as athletes on a team, collectively work toward.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Athletes must work together towards a common goal, overcome obstacles...

members.entity_description: A shared objective that athletes work towards together in the context of sports.

args.new_description: Emotional and motivational states elicited by sports for fans and participants, including excitement, belonging, pride, camaraderie, and inspiration.
args.justification: Both classes describe psychological states and emotions arising from sports contexts (thrill, inspiration, belonging, pride, camaraderie of fans) and are overlapping subsets of the same underlying concept of sports-related emotional experiences.
Assigning the merged emotional-experiences class to a shared group that captures sports' role in shaping community and social-psychological experiences.
Sport-Driven Social Cohesion describes community bonds formed through sport and fits within a broader group focused on sport, community, and social experience.
Human Participants in Sport are the actors underpinning the same sport-driven community and social experiences, so they belong in the shared group.
Sports Fandom Actors (fans, favorite athletes and teams) are key social actors in sports-related community and emotional experiences, fitting the same overarching group.
Sports-Related Traditions are cultural practices arising from shared sporting experiences and align with the sport-and-community social experience theme.
Common Goal is a group-oriented concept central to team dynamics and collective experience in sport, so it fits under the same sport, community, and social experience group.

executed_decisions.justification: Both classes describe psychological states and emotions arising from sports contexts (thrill, inspiration, belonging, pride, camaraderie of fans) and are overlapping subsets of the same underlying concept of sports-related emotional experiences.
Assigning the merged emotional-experiences class to a shared group that captures sports' role in shaping community and social-psychological experiences.
Sport-Driven Social Cohesion describes community bonds formed through sport and fits within a broader group focused on sport, community, and social experience.
Human Participants in Sport are the actors underpinning the same sport-driven community and social experiences, so they belong in the shared group.
Sports Fandom Actors (fans, favorite athletes and teams) are key social actors in sports-related community and emotional experiences, fitting the same overarching group.
Sports-Related Traditions are cultural practices arising from shared sporting experiences and align with the sport-and-community social experience theme.
Common Goal is a group-oriented concept central to team dynamics and collective experience in sport, so it fits under the same sport, community, and social experience group.

cluster_classes.class_description: Core ethical and social values commonly promoted through sports participation, including cooperation, self-control, and respect for rules and opponents.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Sports...promoting values such as teamwork, discipline, and fair play.

members.entity_description: Value emphasizing cooperative effort among individuals, promoted by participation in sports.
Value involving self-control and adherence to rules, highlighted as promoted by sports.
Value of acting honestly and respecting rules and opponents in sports.

cluster_classes.class_description: Human actors at different scales whose relationships are influenced by sports, from single persons to larger groups.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: individuals and communities ... whose culture and cohesion can be shaped by sports

members.entity_description: Single persons who participate in or are affected by sports.
Groups of people whose culture and cohesion can be shaped by sports.

cluster_classes.class_description: Organized sports competitions that involve participants and/or spectators, ranging from small community matches to larger structured games.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Sporting events, whether they are local games or international tournaments, have the power to unite people...

members.entity_description: Organized competitions or games that bring people together as spectators or participants.
Smaller-scale sporting events held within local communities.

cluster_classes.class_description: Concepts describing the domain of sports and the act of taking part in them, including organized physical activities and engagement in those activities.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Organized physical activities and competitions, and the act of individuals taking part in sports activities.

members.entity_description: Organized physical activities and games, including competitions and events, that shape culture and society, promote values and social change, and have significant economic impact.
The act of individuals taking part in sports activities.

cluster_classes.class_description: Challenges or difficulties that individuals must overcome when engaging in activities such as sports participation.
cluster_classes.evidence_excerpt: Challenges or difficulties that athletes need to overcome in sports participation.

members.entity_description: Challenges or difficulties that athletes need to overcome in sports participation.

splits.name: Sports (Domain Concept)
splits.description: The general concept of sports as organized physical activities and games, including competitions and events with cultural, social, and economic impact.

splits.name: Sports Participation Activities
splits.description: Activities involving individuals taking part in sports, emphasizing the act and process of participating.

args.justification: The original 'Sports Participation Concepts' class mixes the broad domain concept of 'sports' with the distinct activity of 'participation in sports'; splitting improves semantic coherence of each class.
Assigning a shared Class_Group 'Sports and Society' to connect sports-related value concepts with other sports domain classes in this cluster.
Set Class_Group to 'Sports and Society' to align social units affected by sports with other sports-domain classes.
Sporting events are core structures within the sports domain and should share the 'Sports and Society' Class_Group with related classes.
Participation obstacles are challenges specific to engaging in sports and thus belong in the same 'Sports and Society' Class_Group.
The split class representing the general concept of sports should be grouped with other sports-related social and conceptual classes under 'Sports and Society'.
The split class for sports participation activities fits the same overarching domain and should share the 'Sports and Society' Class_Group.

The split class representing the general concept of sports should be grouped with other sports-related social and conceptual classes under 'Sports and Society'.
The split class for sports participation activities fits the same overarching domain and should share the 'Sports and Society' Class_Group.
